title: X Factor: Celebrity’s Martin Bashir jokes he bribed Simon Cowell with a Bentley

Last weekend, viewers watched in shock as Ricki Lake and Olivia Olson became the first stars to be booted off the first live show of The X Factor : Celebrity.

After Simon Cowell decided to send home the Love Actually child star instead of journalist Martin Bashir, 56, Martin joked that he bribed the music mogul with a Bentley.

Speaking to The Sun at last night's Pride Of Britain Awards, the iconic journalist praised Olivia but joked about how he bribed Simon to stay on the singing competition.

(Image: PA)

He said: "What a beautiful person Olivia is, with an incredible voice.

"She should have stayed in, I shouldn't have got through."

He teased: "I gave Simon a Bentley Mulsanne Turbo just before I went on and he seemed to think that was helpful. It worked!"

On Saturday, there were boos ringing around the studio when Simon decided to send Olivia home and save Martin.

(Image: ITV)

Giving his verdict, Simon said: "I think you're both in this situation because of song choices. Being impartial, I’m making this decision on who I believe the public would like to see through to next week.

"Based on that reason the person I’m sending home is, unfortunately, Olivia."

Even saved celebrity Martin admitted that Olivia was a much better singer than him.

(Image: PA)

On whether he expected to be saved, he said: "I didn’t and Olivia is a wonderful vocalist. 10 times what I am. It's really tough. We knew when we came into this it was going to be hard."

However, other TV judge Louis Walsh has since slammed Simon for saving Martin.

After suggesting Martin has zero chance of winning The X Factor : Celebrity, Louis said the journalist isn't a very good singer.

Speaking exclusively to Mirror Online at the Pride of Britain awards, he said: "Everyone is so good, nobody's bad ... Martin Bashir's not great but he knows that."

(Image: ITV)

He added: "He had a great story and he's a great raconteur, he's just not a great singer."

The hard nosed journalist has secured some of the most coveted interviews ever.

From Princess Diana to Michael Jackson, the news man has never been afraid to ask the hard questions.
description: After Simon Cowell sent home Olivia Olson instead of the journalist, Martin has joked that he bribed the music mogul with a Bentley
